description:
value of the time required for the reverse current of a diode to recover to a specified value, when switched from a specified forward current to a specified reverse voltage, at specified conditions.
The reverse recovery time is measured as the time interval between t_0, the point where the forward current crosses the zero current axis, and the instant when for decreasing values of iR a line through the points for 0.9 I_RM and 0.25 I_RM crosses the zero current axis.
An alternative method for specifying the recovery value of i_R is to express it as a percentage (e.g. 10%) of the I_RM. The method used is normally described in the product specifying documentation.
